ygData.subject: Two Examples of NEAT Plus Local Search, (2) To (3) Orders-of Magnitude Faster

From: "afcarl2" <a.carl@...>
Subject: Two Examples of NEAT Plus Local Search, (2) To (3) Orders-of Magnitude Faster
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=281645563; y=66_ihXvK-MLcUrqr-dyGw0RCqEWECsej0t_fZtDYlQ7vOg
X-Yahoo-Profile: afcarl2

I - SUMMARY:
Two example problems ("A" and "B"), representative of routine =

aerospace tasks, are presented illustrating typical comparative 
solution =
trajectories for NEAT vs. NEAT plus Local Search (NPLS). In 
both instances=
, NPLS was shown to demonstrate convergence rates that 
were (2) to (3) ord=
ers-of-magnitude (OOM) faster than NEAT alone, 
with results that were (1) =
to (3) OOM better than NEAT, as measured 
by the associated Errorsum values=
.


II - PROBLEM STATEMENT:
1. Problem "A": # Inputs =3D 5, # Objectives =
=3D 5
2. Problem "B": # Inputs =3D 4, # Objectives =3D 5
3. Problem "B" is =
an engineering simplification of Problem "A".
4. Both problem utilize the s=
ame set of weights applied to the 
objectives which are summed together to =
transform the problem into a 
mono-objective problem amenable to the NEAT m=
ethodology.
5. In all other respects, unless otherwise stated, Problem "A" =
is 
identical to Problem "B".
6. Population Size: (10)
7. Number of Generat=
ions: (1) to (1000)
8. Modified version of NEAT (C++), MATLAB/SIMULINK used=
 for fitness 
evaluation and local search.
9. Local search implemented to c=
ontinue until errorsum increases.
10. Each run of NEAT (i.e. 1, 10, 100, 10=
00 generations) used 
different starting populations (i.e. different runs w=
/ system time 
random seed).
11. NPLS utilized Local Search on each NEAT or=
ganism, with Local 
Search fitness accorded to original NEAT organism (i.e.=
 no genome 
changes).


III - RESULTS SUMMARY:
1. Problem "A": 
A) Speed of=
 Convergence by Fitness Evaluations: NPLS (122.0) times 
faster than NEAT (=
 10,000 evals total / 82 evals total)
B) Speed of Convergence by Generation=
s: NPLS (1000) times faster than 
NEAT ( 1,000 gen / 1 gen )
C) Accuracy of=
 Convergence: NPLS errorsum (11.9) times smaller than 
NEAT ( 4319.31 / 362=
.54 )

2. Problem "B": 
A) Speed of Convergence by Fitness Evaluations: NPL=
S (74.6) times 
faster than NEAT ( 10,000 evals total / 134 evals total)
B)=
 Speed of Convergence by Generations: NPLS (1000) times faster than 
NEAT (=
 1,000 gen / 1 gen )
C) Accuracy of Convergence: NPLS errorsum (666.1) time=
s smaller than 
NEAT ( 48.9223 / 0.073442 )


IV - CONCLUSIONS:
1. Best NPL=
S end point did not come from lowest NEAT errorsum start 
point.
2. NPLS co=
nverged (2) to (3) orders-of-magnitude faster than NEAT, 
with Errorsums (1=
) to (3) orders-of-magnitude smaller than NEAT.
3. NEAT is better by itself=
 than Local Search is by itself.
4. NEAT is better/faster with Local Search=
 than by itself.
